It belongs to the family Pterobryaceae and is characterized by its delicate, leaf-like structures that form dense, mat-like growths on rocky substrates. The plant exhibits a unique morphology with elongated, acicular leaves that are often covered in a thin layer of mucilage. It thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Grantia kuhkhajensis is considered a vulnerable species.
